title: The. Transcendence of Memory, Meaning and the Shape of Suffering
description:
Matt, whose interests tend towards philosophy, and Michael, towards computer science and the role of symbol in language, have a wide ranging discussion on Barfield, Di Fuccia, Kierkegaard and Nietzsche. Background on Matt, Michael and Karen follows the notes.

Along the way, we hit upon:

The calling forth of Virtue
Polarization
Thomas Kuhn on paradigm shifts, two lenses, same screen
Non-identical Repetition
The Plenitude and the Passion
Aristotle's views on philosophy v. tragedy
The Biblical narrative
Chiastic structures

Videos that relate to similar topics:
Michael and Di Fuccia on Barfield:  https://youtu.be/-OHk6pr5tiM
Michael and Karen on Barfield and language: https://youtu.be/jBO3MUl0k0Y
Michael and Karen on Avoiding the Perils of Postmodernism:
  https://youtu.be/q-C7iJE0YFY
Matt and Karen on Living Out Holy Moments - 
  the Ascent of the Heart:  https://youtu.be/77zMqCeEyik.    

Karen's Story https://youtu.be/ZC03aNsPHOQ
Paul VanderKlay with Karen https://youtu.be/HlMgGkwWUNY
Karen's Channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgp_...
Paul VanderKlay first conversation with Michael https://youtu.be/82SzWEmQHCI
PVK second conversation with Michael https://youtu.be/s9C4VR9CyjM
PVK first conversation with Matt:  https://youtu.be/QuUYpLhypUk
